channel.title: Conversations on public relations
channel.description:
A series of informal half-hour discussions on the nature and ethics of public relations. Series is hosted by Philip Lesly, editor of the Public Relations Handbook.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Trends and problems in P.R.
item.description: This program features Milton Fairman of the Borden Company; and Howard Hudson, editor of The Quarterly Review of Public Relations.
item.dc:creator: Lesly, Philip, 1918-
item.dc:subject: Public relations

item.title: Functions of public relations
item.description: This program features Glen Perry of DuPont Corporation, and L.L.L. Golden, columnist, Saturday Review.
item.dc:creator: Lesly, Philip, 1918-
item.dc:subject: Public relations

item.title: Public relations and the public interest
item.description: This program features Eugene Miller, vice president, McGraw-Hill Publishing; and Professor Raymond Simon, Syracuse University.
item.dc:creator: Lesly, Philip, 1918-
item.dc:subject: Public relations

item.title: Why and what is public relations?
item.description: This program features William Howlett, president of Consolidated Foods; and Professor Scott Cutlip of University of Wisconsin.
item.dc:creator: Lesly, Philip, 1918-
item.dc:subject: Public relations
